author: Amy Judd
title: Light snow falling and sticking in Metro Vancouver - BC | Globalnews.ca
text:
February 24, 2017 10:14 am Updated: February 24, 2017 10:47 am Light snow falling and sticking in Metro Vancouver By Amy Judd Online News Producer Global News 
A fresh dusting of snow in New Westminster Friday morning. @uniontrevor1975 What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' editorial staff without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... X What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... - 
Winter is not quite over yet in Metro Vancouver. 
Snow was falling again in a number of areas overnight and during the early hours of Friday. 
It is sticking in some places, such as New Westminster, Surrey, Langley, Coquitlam and Port Coquitlam. 
Higher elevations will see more snow than areas near sea level but accumulations will still be minimal. Snowing this morning in Langley ❄️❄️. @GlobalBC pic.twitter.com/hEDERejvLG 
— Ted Field (@tedfieldglobal) February 24, 2017 Just a light dusting of snow in @CityofPoCo this morn. Pls tell me @GlobalBC this is it! pic.twitter.com/5sgTJbG4Ak 
— Sherry Goff (@sherry_goff_) February 24, 2017 @YvonneSchalle Wet snow start falling in Guildford area abit heavy at times pic.twitter.com/fQVUN39D5S 
— Raymond Hoang (@Ray_31) February 24, 2017 
It is expected the light snow will turn to rain later today. 
It’s already been a long winter with several rounds of snow storms and many Metro Vancouver residents say they’ve had enough. 
And the region is nearing Edmonton snow totals for the season. 
Edmonton has seen 67 centimetres of snow fall since October. Vancouver has had 63 centimetres. 
But Abbotsford is the winner right now with about 108 centimetres in total. © 2017 Global News, a division of Corus Entertainment Inc.
